name: The Meritage Resort and Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I purchased the Groupon that included a 1-night stay in one of the suites along with wine tasting and bowling for two, both on-site. Every room also comes with a bottle of wine in the mini-fridge. The rooms were clean, eloquent, and fairly large. Overall, it was a great couple's getaway where everything we needed was on the property.
reviews.title: Wonderful resort on the outskirts of Napa

reviews.text: We had so much fun. I liked the options for all the different activities available. The shining star of our trip was "Kristin" in the Blend cafe. She was personable , informative and fun. We had a spa experience as well. We loved the cave steam room too. Great massage by Laura and cheese a platter as well. I will come back in the summer to enjoy more of the outdoor activities. I look forward to lounging by the outdoor adults only pool.
reviews.title: Great place and people

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Meritage was a great place with nice amenities. The bed was comfortable and the accommodations were very comfortable. The bottle of white wine at check-in was very welcoming along with 2 bottles of water in the refrigerator. We didn't get the room with pool view and patio we had requested at reservation a month before. After we had checked out an upgraded larger room with parking lot views and dirt bank view topped by a vineyard, we got a smaller room with a view of the pool and no parking lot view, but no patio as well.
reviews.title: Great accommodations in resort setting!

reviews.text: The wine tasting at the Trinitas was great! The restaurant, Siena, was wonderful with great food and excellent wait staff. Wish we had had time to try the spa services, but alas there was no time. The bowling alley was fun with florescent bowling balls. We went to a few other wineries while we were there and had a wonderful time.
reviews.title: Nice Resort

reviews.text: I stayed at this resort for 2 days for a work event. The resort itself is very nice with a large campus including restaurants, spas, wine tasting and more. Rooms were comfortable and the food and wine were good. We hit a few wineries while we there and they seemed to be a good distance from the resort, which was the only downside. I view this as a nice choice for a getaway weekend and would stay again.
reviews.title: Marvelous stay - excellent customer service!

reviews.text: We stayed for a week at the Meritage Resort and Spa in Napa Valley.
reviews.title: A Bright Sunny Stay

reviews.text: A fantastic experience, a very comfortable experience with breath taking views of the vineyard from our suit balcony. Food was great in restaurant. Although service was very slow and lousy. Because I was dining alone with my baby, they tended to forget about me. However the Restaurant Manager was very attentive and saw that I was eventually taken care of.
reviews.title: Prefect location, hotel fee and taxes are high

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is very clean, turn down excellent. Bed was very comfy. Unfortunately I did not have time to use the spa facilities. On a whole, I would definitely stay again if over in Napa.
reviews.title: Third Time's a Charm

reviews.text: The location is the best in Napa. But it is not much activities around on winter time. The dinner per a person on Chritmas day is $55 inside restrurant and reservation is required. on top of hotel taxes per room rate, $25 resort fee is charged.
reviews.title: Enchanting

reviews.text: This was our third visit to the Meritage and it was quite charming. We had a lovely king patio room overlooking the vineyards. Because it was chilly, we didn't spend any time out there so save your money if you go in the winter and reserve a non patio room.
reviews.title: Luxurious, comfortable, beautiful California style

reviews.text: This resort is located in an office park area, about 7 miles from downtown Napa. The room we had was a double queen. Very beautiful and spacious with a large bathroom. Room service was efficient, and the breakfast delivered was excellent. We dined in both Crush (salads for lunch were nice) and Siena, where I had a delicious chicken avocado club for lunch. The spa is gorgeous. I enjoyed a nice massage and relaxed in the sauna followed by the jacuzzi. I highly recommend these services and/or the tasting room in 'The Cave'. Anytime we needed anything, the staff was accommodating and polite. My only gripes were on check in, we noticed the room refrigerator was not working and it required calling guest services three times (within four hours)before a maintenance man finally showed up, switching our refrigerator with another. On our morning of check out, we were relaxing in the room, when at 8:30am, housekeeping knocked on the door to see if we had left yet. This is just too early, in my opinion. We did receive a corporate rate of $159/night and for this rate, and even a bit more, I would return.
reviews.title: Would return, even with a couple glitches.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Driving up to the The Meritage Resort and Spa was seeing a beautiful resort. From the time we entered the resort the warmth and friendlness of the staff was apparent everywhere!! The man
reviews.title: What a wonderful place to stay!
The Meritage
reviews.text: at reservations was so pleasant and helpful! Our room had water and a welcoming bottle of wine for us! We truly enjoyed The Crush with its unique bowling alleys, great food and wonderful staff that were so attentive! We enjoyed the wine tasting in Trinitas Wine Cave,too.. We had dinner at the Siena Restaurant that was amazing with wonderful service! The grounds are extraordinary and pictures do not do it justice! Getting up in the morning and looking out over the vineyards is breath-taking! We can hardly wait to go back! Great job by all!! Claudiac 01/17/13

Meritage is a great place to stay. My wife and I were here for a meeting and enjoyed the spacious room and excellent service. We got the room at a conference rate of $159 a night in January. We'd love to stay in the spring or summer when the grapevines are green. I want to pay a particular compliment to Kristin in their little coffee shop called Blend. She epitomized customer sfervice. I told her I was going to recommend her for a raise! So, if her manager is reading this, give her a raise!
reviews.title: One great experience

reviews.text: We stayed three days on Jan, ate a very good meal in the restaurant, visited the "cave", wine tasting room, and enjoyed every minute of our stay.
reviews.title: Manny in Room Service

reviews.text: The resort and facilities are lovely as well as the Spa. The bar, Crush, is a chill venue w bowling lanes and tasty appetizers. Our server Jack was pretty awesome - attentive and charming. Even if he didn't have a Snuggie for us....
reviews.title: Crush

reviews.text: The service was EXCELLENT and beyond standard!! I attended the Meritage for a conference and suffice it to say that the staff was excellent. Very generous and supportive with needs and inquiries. The managemen, however, did a poor job relating needs to its staff and there were many issues.
reviews.title: Great service...poor management

reviews.text: To name a few of the staff: Mary in banquet services, Lauren at Crush, Missy at the front desk, Kevin at the concierge desk, Jake at the Sierra restaurant (VERY knowledgeable) and there was a bell hop that was absolutely fantastic that I can't remember.
reviews.title: Great Quiet Resort

reviews.text: I stayed here while on a business trip to the area.Never got to explore the facility really well but it does feature modern amenities to make anyone's trip comfortable. The front desk and the staff in general are very pleasant.
reviews.title: Very pleased

reviews.text: Though my schedule was tight, I manage to visit four vineyards since the Retort is well situated.
reviews.title: Trinitas Cellars Wine Tasting

description: A destination unto itself The Meritage Resort and Spa has a lot to offer! The resort lies against its own vineyard with walking trails and offers over 300 Tuscan inspired guestrooms and luxury suites. Guests are treated to accommodations featuring oversized terraces, granite counters and plasma TVs. Chefs in the award winning Siena restaurant use local, seasonal and sustainable ingredients. The new Crush Ultra Lounge features six luxury bowling lanes, a full bar, shuffleboard, a pool table and darts in addition to lunch and dinner items. In true Italian fashion, Blend Café offers espressos, café lattes and teas plus fresh pastries, baked goods, savory items and gelatos.Regain a healthful balance with curative treatments at Spa Terra – a lavish underground Napa lavish spa with steam grottos, soaking pools, 12 treatment alcoves and tranquil walls of water. Guests can also enjoy the Trinitas Cellars Tasting Room or host an intimate event in the Estate Cave. The resort has the most comprehensive event and meeting space north of the Golden Gate Bridge and west of Sacramento with 50,000 square feet of meeting space including the two largest ballrooms in the Napa Valley.The resort also features Our Lady of the Grapes, one of the only private wedding chapels in the Napa Valley, bocce ball, outdoor fireplaces with seating areas and a state-of-the-art fitness studio that opens onto a patio with views of private vineyards and olive trees. The Meritage Resort and Spa. We Are Napa.
